notes: Paste each table as raw_lines in subsequent records. Keep original line order; no offsets needed.

title: Table 1: Terms and Concepts
rows: Real Beneficiary
The actual person who owns or controls the legal entity or specific account.
Enhanced Due Diligence - EDD
Additional verification procedures are taken when dealing with high-risk applicants to ensure a comprehensive understanding of their financial activities.
Customer Due Diligence - CDD
A set of standard procedures for verifying the identity of customers and assessing their risks before the start of a financial relationship.
Anti-Money Laundering Reports – AML Reports
Reports prepared to document suspicious activities related to money laundering.
Compliance Management
Overseeing operations and procedures to ensure compliance with laws and regulations.
Legal Person

Legal persons refer to any entities other than natural persons that can register or renew a license with the registrar or otherwise own assets. This can include companies, business bodies, foundations, partnerships, associations, and other related entities.
Natural Person
Is the individual human being who has legal rights and responsibilities and can engage in legal activities such as contracting and ownership.
Nominal Beneficiary
A company representative or other professional intermediary who acts as a director or secretary of a partnership and holds a similar position in a company or legal entity.
Politically Exposed

Politically exposed persons hold or hold public office, as well as their family members and close associates. They may be a director, a person authorized to act on behalf of the company, or a beneficial owner of the company.
Organizational Structure

Legal entity or arrangement. Includes legal entities such as trusts, limited partnerships, foundations, limited liability companies, cooperatives, etc. May be less transparent due to multiple ownership, control, and profit interests over different roles.
Board Member

A board member is appointed as part of a group called the "board of directors," which is responsible for making strategic decisions and overseeing the management of the company. The role of a board member is to contribute to the direction of the company and achieve its long-term goals.
Managing Director

He is the person who is appointed by the board of directors to be the company's top executive or manager. The managing director is primarily responsible for the day-to-day operations and management of the company and works to implement the policies and decisions made by the board of directors.
Digital Identity Account (SOP1)
A digital identity account that includes a valid mobile phone number and email address. It can be used by those outside the country without an Emirates ID number and is used for default approval.
Digital Identity Account (SOP2)
A digital identity account that includes a mobile phone number, an approved email, and a unified paper. It can be used by those inside the country without an Emirates ID number.
Digital Identity Account (SOP3)
A digital identity account that includes your phone number, email address, Emirates ID, and an approved signature for legal transactions.
Black List
This is a list containing data on individuals for whom the Department will not issue any economic licenses and who will not be able to access the Department's services on the Tamm platform.
Internal Security Lists - CID
National Security adds banned individuals to this list. These individuals are prohibited from submitting requests for the department's services on the Tamm platform.

title: Table 2: Linking Requirements
rows: National Economic Record
Obtaining license data issued in other emirates to facilitate customer service and reduce manual data entry.
1. License number 2. Emirate in which the license was issued

All license-related information, such as (company type, legal status, full name of the company in Arabic and English, address of the company's headquarters, company structure information, owner information, ownership percentages, a copy of the license, and the articles of association). If any of thıese information are not available, the applicant must complete them.

title: Table 4: Declaration exemption cases
rows: Public joint stock company

Exempt from the declaration of the real beneficiary and considered as a natural person according to Clause 12.1 of the Guide, and they will be automatically registered. The application will be submitted and the registration number will be automatically issued upon completion of the licensing process.
Government company according to the rules of work
Exempt from the declaration of the real beneficiary and considered as a natural person in the beneficial ownership structure.

title: Table 10: Process – Submitting a new registration application
rows: User
Investor / Applicant
Pre-requisite
1. Verify the applicant's digital ID entry level. 2. Verify eligibility requirements. 3. Verify the presence of available trade names (issued and unlicensed).
Input

1. The applicant selects the "New Compliance Registration Request" option. 2. The applicant enters the trade name data according to the business requirements for the Trade Name Reservation service, and adds the additional data required to complete the compliance requirements. 3. The applicant enters the partnership structure data and the Beneficiary Declaration data – this data is extracted from the data entered in the previous steps. 4. The applicant designates a contact person, pledges the accuracy of the data, and submits the request.
Output

1. The registration request number is sent to the applicant via text message and email (according to the notification settings). 2. A request is created in the internal department's system and is assigned to an employee of the internal work teams, according to the privileges matrix. 3. The request may be resent by the work team to the applicant to complete any missing details. 4. A notification of the request's final result is sent to the applicant after the request has been processed, as stated in the notification section. 5. If the request is approved, a unified registration number and a record certificate of the real beneficiary are issued.
Alternative Choice

1. The applicant must have a current license and have not registered a beneficiary declaration, and there is no unified registration number issued for this license. The applicant must have an available trade name, and wishes to submit a new registration application using this name to obtain a unified registration number.
